page.title: 09Retired to N.Luffenham
page.content: A married couple retired to N.L.from Kent.They came to this area to be near relatives who had wartime associations with R.A.F. N.L. They also find the area attractive.The wife is settled but her husband wants to return South where there are more activities.Both find the continuous change of neighbours (many of whom are R.A.F.personnel) unsettling.Along with this they feel that as they age and can no longer drive,they will be isolated in the village.The bus service is very limited and travel by taxi is expensive. Village activities for the retired are :_"Evergreens", allotments (for the gardener),"Chater Bowls Club"and the village cricket team.Much of the wife's leisure time is spent in voluntary work in Stamford.They wish to leave N.L.and move nearer their daughter or son.
